UNIQUAC (picmol.models.uniquac)¶

picmol.models.uniquac.UNIQUAC_R(smiles: list)[source]¶

Calculates the UNIQUAC r parameter for a list of molecules.

The r parameter represents the relative size of a molecule in the UNIQUAC model. It is calculated by summing the r parameters of the subgroups (k) present in the molecule.

The UNIQUAC r parameter for molecule i is calculated using the following equation:

\[r_i = \sum_k \nu_{ki} r_k\]

where:

  • \(\nu_{ki}\) is the number of occurrences of subgroup k in molecule i

Parameters:

smiles (list) – a list of SMILES strings representing the molecules

Returns:

array containing the r parameters for each molecule

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

picmol.models.uniquac.UNIQUAC_Q(smiles: list)[source]¶

Calculates the UNIQUAC q parameter for a list of molecules.

The q parameter represents the relative surface area of a molecule in the UNIQUAC model. It is calculated by summing the q parameters of the subgroups (k) present in the molecule.

The UNIQUAC q parameter is calculated for molecule i using the following equation:

\[q_i = \sum_k \nu_{ki} q_k\]

where:

  • \(\nu_{ki}\) is the number of occurrences of subgroup k in molecule i

Parameters:

smiles (list) – list of SMILES strings representing the molecules

Returns:

array containing the q parameters for each molecule

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

picmol.models.uniquac.fit_du_to_Hmix(T, Hmix, z, smiles)[source]¶

Fits UNIQUAC interaction parameters (\(\Delta u_{ij}\)) to experimental heat of mixing (Hmix) data.

This function uses the scipy.optimize.curve_fit function to determine the UNIQUAC interaction parameters (\(\Delta u_{ij}\)) that best fit the experimental heat of mixing data.

Parameters:

  • T (float) – temperature (K)

  • Hmix (numpy.ndarray) – array of experimental enthalpy of mixing values

  • z (numpy.ndarray) – array of mole fractions

  • smiles (list) – list of SMILES strings representing the molecules

Returns:

array of fitted UNIQUAC interaction parameters (\(\Delta u_{ij}\))

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

picmol.models.uniquac.fit_du_to_GM(T, GM, z, smiles)[source]¶

Fits UNIQUAC interaction parameters (\(\Delta u_{ij}\)) to experimental Gibbs free energy of mixing (GM) data.

This function uses the scipy.optimize.curve_fit function to determine the UNIQUAC interaction parameters (\(\Delta u_{ij}\)) that best fit the experimental Gibbs free energy of mixing data.

Parameters:

  • T (float) – temperature (K)

  • GM (numpy.ndarray) – array of experimental Gibbs free energy of mixing values.

  • z (numpy.ndarray) – array of mole fractions.

  • smiles (list) – list of SMILES strings representing the molecules.

Returns:

array of fitted UNIQUAC interaction parameters (\(\Delta u_{ij}\)).

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

class picmol.models.uniquac.UNIQUAC(IP, smiles, z=None, r=None, q=None)[source]¶

UNIQUAC (UNIversal QUAsiChemical) model class.

This class implements the UNIQUAC activity coefficient model for calculating thermodynamic properties of multi-component mixtures.

Parameters:

  • IP (numpy.ndarray) – array of interaction parameters (\(\Delta u_{ij}\)).

  • smiles (list) – list of SMILES strings representing the molecules in the mixture.

  • z (numpy.ndarray, optional) – composition array (mole fractions). If None, it defaults to values from PointDisc.

  • r (numpy.ndarray, optional) – UNIQUAC r parameters for each component. If None, it will be calculated from smiles.

  • q (numpy.ndarray, optional) – UNIQUAC q parameters for each component. If None, it will be calculated from smiles.

property zc¶
Returns:

coordination number, set to 10

Return type:

float

property r¶

Retrieves the r parameter (i.e., relative size of a molecule) for each component from UNIQUAC_R().

Returns:

array of r parameters for each component

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

property q¶

Retrieves the q parameter (i.e., the relative surface area of a molecule) for each component from UNIQUAC_Q().

Returns:

array of q parameters for each component

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

property l¶

Calculates the UNIQUAC parameter l for each component from r and q parameters using the coordination number zc.

\[l_i = \frac{z_c}{2}(r_i - q_i) - (r_i - 1) \]
Returns:

array of l parameters for each component

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

property rbar¶

Calculates the mixture average r parameter.

\[\overline{r} = \sum_i^n x_i r_i\]
Returns:

linear combination of r parameter for each component in mixture

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

property qbar¶

Calculates the mixture average q parameter.

\[\overline{q} = \sum_i^n x_i q_i\]
Returns:

linear combination of q parameter for each component in mixture

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

property lbar¶

Calculates the mixture average l parameter.

\[\overline{l} = \sum_i^n x_i l_i\]
Returns:

linear combination of l parameter for each component in mixture

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

property phi¶

Calculates the segment fraction \(\phi\) for each component.

\[\phi_i = \frac{x_i r_i}{\bar{r}}\]
Returns:

array of segment fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

property theta¶

Calculates the area fraction \(\theta\) for each component.

\[\theta_i = \frac{x_i q_i}{\bar{q}}\]
Returns:

array of area fractions

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

tau(T)[source]¶

Calculates the UNIQUAC interaction parameter \(\tau\).

\[\tau_{ij} = \exp\left( -\frac{\Delta u_{ij}}{RT} \right)\]
Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

array of \(\tau\) parameters

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

rho(T)[source]¶

Calculates the \(\rho\) parameter.

\[\rho_i = \sum_j^n \theta_j \tau_{ji}\]
Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

array of \(\rho\) parameters

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Gid(T)[source]¶

Calculates the ideal Gibbs energy of mixing.

\[\frac{G^{id}}{RT} = \sum_i^n x_i \ln x_i\]
Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

ideal Gibbs energy of mixing

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

GE(T)[source]¶

Calculates the excess Gibbs energy.

\[\frac{G^E}{RT} = \sum_i^n x_i \ln \frac{\phi_i}{x_i} + \frac{z_c}{2} \sum_i^n x_i q_i \ln \frac{\theta_i}{\phi_i} - \sum_i^n \left( x_i q_i \ln \sum_j^n \theta_j \tau_{ji} \right)\]
Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

total excess Gibbs energy

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

GM(T)[source]¶

Calculates the total Gibbs free energy of mixing.

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} \frac{\Delta G_{mix}}{RT} &= \frac{G^{id}}{RT} + \frac{G^E}{RT} \\ &= \sum_i^n x_i \ln \phi_i + \frac{z_c}{2} \sum_i^n x_i q_i \ln \frac{\theta_i}{\phi_i} - \sum_i^n \left( x_i q_i \ln \sum_j^n \theta_j \tau_{ji} \right) \end{align}\end{split}\]
Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

total Gibbs free energy of mixing

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

gammas(T)[source]¶

Calculates the activity coefficients of each component in the mixture.

The activity coefficients are calculated using the following equation:

\[\ln \gamma_i = \ln \frac{\phi_i}{x_i} + \frac{z_c}{2} q_i \ln \frac{\theta_i}{\phi_i} + l_i - \frac{\phi_i}{x_i} \bar{l} - q_i \ln \sum_j^n \theta_j \tau_{ji} + q_i - q_i \sum_j^n \frac{\theta_j \tau_{ji}}{\sum_k^n \theta_k \tau_{kj}}\]
Parameters:

T (float or numpy.ndarray) – temperature (K)

Returns:

activity coefficients of each component

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

mu(T)[source]¶

Calculates the chemical potential of each component in the mixture.

\[\frac{\mu_i}{RT} = \ln \phi_i + \frac{z_c}{2} q_i \ln{\frac{\theta_i}{\phi_i}} + l_i - \overline{l}\frac{\phi_i}{x_i} - q_i \ln \sum_{j=1}^n \theta_j \tau_{ji} + q_i - q_i \sum_{j=1}^n \left(\frac{\theta_j \tau_{ij}}{\sum_{k=1}^n \theta_k \tau_{kj}}\right)\]
Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

chemical potential of each component

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dGM_dxs(T)[source]¶

Calculates the first derivative of the Gibbs free energy of mixing with respect to the mol fractions.

\[\frac{\partial \Delta G_{mix}}{\partial x_i} = \mu_i - \mu_n\]
Parameters:

T (float or numpy.ndarray) – temperature (K)

Returns:

first derivative of mixing free energy

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

dmu_dxs(T)[source]¶

Calculates the derivative of the chemical potential with respect to the mol fractions.

\[\frac{1}{RT}\frac{\partial \mu_i}{\partial x_j} = \frac{1}{\phi_i} \frac{\partial \phi_i}{\partial x_j} \left( 1 - q_i \frac{z_c}{2} \right) + \frac{1}{\theta_i} \frac{\partial \theta_i}{\partial x_j} q_i \frac{z_c}{2} - \overline{l} \left( \frac{1}{x_i} \frac{\partial \phi_i}{\partial x_j} - \frac{\delta_{ij} \phi_i}{x_j^2} \right) + \frac{q_i q_j}{\overline{q}} \left( 1 - \frac{\tau_{ji}}{\sum_k^n \theta_k \tau_{kj}} - \frac{\tau_{ij}}{\sum_k^n \theta_k \tau_{ki}} + \sum_l^n \frac{\theta_l \tau_{jl} \tau_{il}}{\left( \sum_k^n \theta_k \tau_{kl} \right)^2} \right)\]
Parameters:

T (float or numpy.ndarray) – temperature (K)

Returns:

second derivative of Gibbs free energy / derivative of chemical potential

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Hij(T)[source]¶

Calculates the Hessian matrix (\(H_{ij}\)) of the Gibbs free energy of mixing with respect to the mol fractions.

\[H_{ij} = \frac{\partial \mu_i}{\partial x_j} - \frac{\partial \mu_n}{\partial x_j} - \frac{\partial \mu_i}{\partial x_n} + \frac{\partial \mu_n}{\partial x_n}\]
Parameters:

T (float or numpy.ndarray) – temperature (K)

Returns:

Hessian matrix of the mixing free energy

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

det_Hij(T)[source]¶

Calculates the determinant of the Hessian matrix of the Gibbs free energy of mixing. This determinant is often used to assess the stability of a mixture.

Parameters:

T (float or numpy.ndarray) – temperature (K)

Returns:

Determinant of the Hessian matrix. Shape is (number of conditions,).

Return type:

numpy.ndarray
